original: Brusewitz, Nore Teodor, läroverksadjunkt, Västervik, f. 1/4/86 i Helsingfors av agronom Adolf B. o. Sigrid Jönsson. G. 17 m. folksk :lär :an Viva Grenholm, d. 37. Barn: Gunhild f. 18, folksk :lär:a, Torsten 20, fil. kand., Ingrid 22, g. m. hälsov :-till-’Syn :m. O. Aström, Birgitta, små-iskolilärarinna. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 04, f olksk :ilär: ex. där 05, fil. mag. 12, stud. i Lund 15, provår där s. å. Res. t. sv. sem. s. resesekr. f. kristl. sem:-rör. 16, t. folksk. i Skåne m. statsstip. 18. Lär. v. N. Angermanl. folkhögsk 11-12, vik. adj. v. Skara folksk :seni. 12-13, i Filipistad 13, v. folksk :sem. i Linköp. 14, lär. i Eslöv 15-16, e. lär. o. e. o. adj. v. Lunds folksk :>sem. 16-19, e. o. lektor där 19-22, adj. i mo-dersm., hist. o. geogr. v. Västerviks h. a. 1. sed. 22, vik. lektor där 33, lär. v. Västerviks stads lärl :’sk. f. handel 23-46. Medl. av kyrkobrödrakåren, söndagsskollär., ordf. i dåv. Riksförb. f. svenskh. bev. lokalavd. i Västervik 26-46, Skr.: Rudenschöldf’or’sk.ningen (46). Brusewitz Beckman, Ester Anna Maria, läroverksadjunkt, Vretakloster, f. 19/1/89 i Heinola, Finl., av ing. Adolf Brusewitz o. Sigrid Jönsson. G. 28 m. agronom Erik Beckman. Barn: Jan f. 30. — Ex. v. h. lärmesem. i Sthlm 11, fil. kand. i Sthlm 24. Vik. v. Karlskrona h. flicklärov. 11-12, ämneslär. v. Majornas elem:lärov. f. fl. i Gbg 1’2-17, Kungsh. flicklärov. i Sthlm 17-18, Whitlockska samisk, där 18-28, e. o. ämneslär. v. Linköp. komm. flicksk. 32-35, adj. i modersm. o. hist. m. sam-h :lära v. Linköp. h. a. 1. sed. 35. Skr.: Almquist som resenär o. diktare (Ord o. Bild 20).
translated: Brusewitz, Nore Teodor, high school teacher, Västervik, born April 1, 1886, in Helsinki, to agronomist Adolf B. and Sigrid Jönsson. Married in 1917 to elementary school teacher Viva Grenholm, who passed away in 1937. Children: Gunhild, born in 1918 and an elementary school teacher, Torsten born in 1920 and a graduate in philosophy, Ingrid born in 1922 and married to a health consultant named Syn m. O. Aström, Birgitta, a teacher in a small school. Completed studies in Uppsala in 1904, earned a degree in elementary school education there in 1905, a master's degree in 1912, studied in Lund in 1915, worked as a teacher in N. Angermanl. folkhögsk from 1911-1912, substitute teacher at Skara folksk :seni. in 1912-1913, in Filipistad in 1913, temporary teacher at folksk :sem. in Linköp. in 1914, teacher in Eslöv from 1915-1916, a teacher and adjunkt at Lunds folksk :>sem. from 1916-1919, an associate professor there from 1919-1922, high school teacher in mother tongue, history, and geography at Västervik's h. a. 1. since 1922, substitute lecturer there in 1933, teacher at Västervik's city apprenticeship school for trade from 1923-1946. Member of the Church Brotherhood, Sunday School teacher, chairman of the former Swedish-speaking population association's local branch in Västervik from 1926-1946. Wrote Rudenschöldf’or'sk.ningen (46). Brusewitz Beckman, Ester Anna Maria, high school teacher, Vretakloster, born January 19, 1889, in Heinola, Finland, to engineer Adolf Brusewitz and Sigrid Jönsson. Married in 1928 to agronomist Erik Beckman. Child: Jan, born in 1930. Completed studies at h. lärmesem. in Stockholm in 1911, a bachelor's degree in Stockholm in 1924. Substitute teacher at Karlskrona h. flicklärov. in 1911-1912, subject teacher at Majornas elem:lärov. for several years in Gothenburg from 1912-1917, Kungsh. flicklärov. in Stockholm from 1917-1918, Whitlockska samisk. there from 1918-1928, associate subject teacher at Linköping municipality's girls' school from 1932-1935, and a teacher in mother tongue, history, and social science at Linköping's h. a. 1 since 1935. Wrote Almquist som resenär o. diktare (Ord o. Bild 20).
